The magnetic force \( F_B \) on the wire BC can be calculated using the formula \( F_B = BIL \cdot \frac{L}{2} \).
The total Ampere force \( F_{\text{total}} \) on the wire ABC is the sum of the magnetic forces \( F_A \) and \( F_B \), which is \( F_{\text{total}} = 2BIL \cdot \frac{L}{2} \).
